item.title: Type Conversion
item.author: houze.zhang@etu.utc.fr (Zane_ZHANG)
item.description: Background This post is excerpted from the 2.1.2 section of C++primer and contains the parts I think are important as well as my comments. The answers to the practice questions in subsection 2.1.2 are included. Highlights The type of an object defines the data that an object might contain and what operations that object can perform. Among the operations that many types support is the ability to convert objects of the given type to other, related types.
